channel.title: jay's musings on
channel.description: Recent content in jay's musings on

item.title: BDP Bandwidth delay product
item.description: The bandwidth-delay product is the product of a data link’s capacity (in bits per second) and its round-trip delay time (in seconds).

item.title: BufferBloat
item.description: Symptoms of bufferbloat-induced congestion Testing Bufferbloat Waveform DSLReports ELI5 Wifi buffers If you’re connecting over WiFi, there are actually three buffers .

item.title: CoDel - Fair Queuing (FQ) with Controlled Delay (CoDel)
item.description: How it works CoDel assumes transient queuing is acceptable, a small amount of standing queue is acceptable, and that it is unacceptable to drop when there are fewer than an MTU worth of bytes in the buffer.

item.title: Coding Uni Prep 2426fa4977da4886af5828c04b8059ef

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Obsidian I recommend using Obsidian as a way to edit and grow your digital garden.

item.title: Home

item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: IRTT
item.description: Source Measurement of: RTT (round-trip time) OWD (one-way delay), given external clock synchronization IPDV (instantaneous packet delay variation), usually referred to as jitter Packet loss, with upstream and downstream differentiation Out-of-order (measured using late packets metric) and duplicate packets Bitrate Timer error, send call time and server processing time Statistics: min, max, mean, median (for most quantities) and standard deviation #networking

item.title: Netcode 01022022
item.description: Notes Ping Ping == RTT ICMP Echo Request Varies highly with congestion Testing IRTT At lower MTU, packet delays are lower than at higher MTU.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: particularly in WiFi
item.description: Another major drawback of WiFi is that unless you have a MU-MIMO access point, your clients can’t “talk” to the access point all at once.

item.title: Setup

item.title: Showcase

Strengthening Online Social Bonds: Research Garden Jacky Zhao’s Garden Anson Yu’s Garden Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory If you want to see your own on here, submit a Pull Request adding yourself to this file!

item.title: Symptoms of bufferbloat-induced congestion
item.description: Once a network is congested, various service protocols (statistically insignificant in terms of additional network load, but mission-critical) can’t do their jobs.

item.title: TCP
item.description: Wiki Congestion control TCP Cubic TCP BBR Wiki TCP over wireless networks TCP was originally designed for wired networks.

item.title: TCP BBR
item.description: Source Intuition Interpreting packet loss as congestion When bottleneck buffers are large, loss-based congestion control keeps them full, causing bufferbloat.

item.title: TCP Cubic
item.description: Wiki CUBIC is used by default in Linux kernels since version 2.6.19. (November 2006) #networking

item.title: ‘Give Away Your Legos’ and Other Commandments for Scaling Startups
item.description: Molly Graham has seen a lot. Her team at Google leapt from 25 to 125 in just 9 months. During her 4+ years at Facebook, the company exploded from 500 employees serving 80 million users to 5,500 employees and over 1.
